location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.216 of 1856 from Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter and its enclosures relate to the shipwreck of a vessel, its plunder by Bahraini subjects, and the alleged murder of a Banyan trader at Bahrain. Jones encloses a copy of his letter (no.181 of 1856) to Commodore Richard Ethersey, Commanding Officer Persian Gulf Squadron, dated 2 June 1856, containing instructions to Ethersey to proceed to Bahrain to conduct investigations. Also enclosed is an extract of paragraph 10 from Etherseyâ€™s reply (letter no.129 of 1856) to Jones, dated 26 June 1856, the original of which enclosed a receipt for the reparations paid by the Shaikh of Bahrain for the plundered property.
